results.title: I, the Aboriginal
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Kip Porteous and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Set in and around Darwin the film discloses the life of an Australian First Nations man as depicted in Douglas Lockwood’s book of the same name. Philip Roberts recalls his early years of tribal life and gradual acceptance by the white community. He receives medical training, and travels frequently to his own people making use of his knowledge.

results.title: House of games
results.creator_credit: David Mamet, Michael Hausman, Orion Pictures Corporation and Filmhaus Productions
results.brief_description: This thriller stars Lindsay Crouse as a successful psychologist and best-selling author of “Driven: obsession and compulsion in everyday life” who becomes increasingly drawn into the shadowy underworld of a confidence trickster, Joe Mantegna, and his enigmatic cohorts, discovering that the thrill of the con answers deep-rooted needs unfulfilled by her daily round of listening to other people’s problems. Screenplay by David Mamet.

results.title: Hotel Sorrento
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Film Victoria, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Horizon Films (AU), Horizon (GB) and Bayside Pictures
results.brief_description: Hotel Sorrento is the story of three sisters who grew up in a small Australian coastal town. One is a successful writer living in London, another a businesswoman in New York, while the third remained at the family home after the death of her husband. When they are reunited after years apart, not only are fond family memories rekindled, but the unspoken feelings and unresolved tensions of past betrayal resurface. When tragedy strikes, they not only confront old wounds but discover that their lives will never be the same again. Starring Caroline Goodall, Caroline Gillmer, Tara Morice and Joan Plowright. Co-starring Ray Barrett, Nicholas Bell, Ben Thomas and John Hargreaves. Based on the stage play of the same name by Hannie Rayson.

results.title: Hotel de Love
results.creator_credit: Craig Rosenburg, David Parker, Michael Lake and Pratt Film Productions
results.brief_description: Teenagers, smooth-talking party animal, Rick (Aden Young) and his shy twin brother Stephen (Simon Bossell) fall for the same gorgeous uni student, Melissa (Saffron Burrows). Rick woos her and then loses her. A decade on and Rick is working as the manager of Hotel de Love, a tacky, neon-laced romantic hideaway, whilst Stephen has buried himself in the world of stockbroking. Life is dull and unchallenging until Melissa arrives at the hotel and the hijinks begin. Also starring Pippa Grandison, Ray Barrett and Julia Blake.

results.title: Hope and glory
results.brief_description: John Boorman recreates the London and England of his childhood, when he was a young boy living through the excitement of the Blitz, whilst the adults around him were dealing with the horror of war as best they could. In contrast to the adult’s fears, for the children the war also brings adventure and excitement, and much of the film’s comedy comes from the differing perspective’s between the “grown-ups” and the “kiddies”. The recreation of war-time London is visually spot-on. Boorman wrote the screenplay. The film stars Sarah Miles.

results.title: Hombre
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Irving Ravetch and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman is the hero in this exciting, hard hitting western. John Russell is a white man raised as an Apache who faces the prejudices of a society which despises him. He is made to sit outside the stage coach by the white passengers who soon find that their lives are dependent on the man they rejected when outlaws leave them stranded in the desert. Co-starring Diane Cilento, Frederic March, Richard Boone and Barbara Rush.

results.title: His Girl Friday (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is the cheeky news editor, Rosalind Russell is the ace female reporter with printer’s ink in her veins. Amid the frenzy of newsmen competing for that front page story, high energy romance, and Ben Hecht’s famous overlapping dialogue and machine-gun paced script, a reporter about to get married and escape the newsworld, stumbles upon the biggest story of her career - a notorious criminal surrenders personally. One of the funniest and most biting screwball comedies on film. Also stars Ralph Bellamy. Based on the 1928 play “The Front page” by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur and a remake of the 1931 Howard Hughes film “The Front page”.

results.title: Hiroshima mon amour
results.creator_credit: Alain Resnais, Samy Halfron, Shirakawa Takeo, Sacha Kamenka, Daiei Motion Picture Company, Pathe Overseas, Como Films and Argos Films
results.brief_description: A French actress, in Hiroshima to take part in a film about peace, has a brief affair with a Japanese man. As they discuss the horror and consequences of the nuclear destruction of the city, the woman slowly, hesitantly begins to reveal the story of her own individual horror when she was punished for loving a German soldier during World war II. Combining footage of the destruction of Hiroshima, the film eschews linear narrative and instead moves back and forth between the past and present, exploring the effects of memory and trauma. Scripted by novelist Marguerite Duras, “Hiroshima Mon Amour” heralded a new phase for international cinema, a precursor to the New Wave, and the development of a cinema that would explore contemporary questions of philosophy and politics. Though the “stories” which the film explores are powerfully involving, the formal structure of the film forces the viewer to confront his or her own personal construction of “memory” as mediated through film and history. The film shows the impossibility of “explaining” Hiroshima but also convincingly explores the need to permanently interrogate the conditions which led to Hiroshima.

results.title: High society (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sol Siegel, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation and Charles Walters
results.brief_description: Bing Crosby, Grace Kelly and Frank Sinatra romp elegantly through the scenic, moneyed grounds and waters of outwardly elitist Newport, Rhode Island in this hip, witty, musical version of Philip Barry’s ‘The Philadelphia story’. Legendary Louis Armstrong, starring as himself, plays his trumpet and narrates in prose and song the peccadillos of his song-writer friend C. K. Dexter-Haven as he tries to win back his haughty ex-wife on the eve of her marriage. Music by Cole Porter.
